My Journey to Mid-Level iOS Developer

Advancing as a Junior Developer Roadmap

With so much information out there, here are some suggestions to advance your knowledge:

Three Components for Swift Development:

  • Views and Model
  • Networking / Swift Data
  • Packages / Libraries - Server Side

Resources:

  • Hacking with Swift
  • Unwrap App
  • How to navigate using WWDC videos, watching with a purpose
  • Contribute to open-source code, Swift mentorship, or find a mentor

Foundation: Algorithms

  • Exercism
  • LeetCode

And for fun, learn or advance in Chess ðŸ™‚

Example of a Weekly Study Plan:

Day Activities
Monday Study Swift UI, Practice Algorithms
Tuesday Watch WWDC videos, Code along with tutorials
Wednesday Peer-to-peer session/consultation
Thursday Contribute to open-source or practice server-side code
Friday Reflect on the weekâ€™s learning, Study Algorithms

Questions to ask yourself:

  • Can I replicate a sample tutorial on my own?
  • List 3 key points you have learned from a video?
  • Reach out to a team member for a peer-to-peer session/consultation on a specific topic
  • What are your strengths and weaknesses?
  • What key areas do you need to work on?
